name: NPR
text:
NEW: White House adviser Stephen Miller has tested positive for the coronavirus — the latest in a string of nearly 2 dozen positive cases in the last week among close contacts to the White House.
https://t.co/oafZ56zhcQ

name: NPR
text:
President Trump is "mocking us, the working poor," says Norma, one of the roughly 2 million domestic workers in the U.S.

She and her mother were infected with the coronavirus earlier this year. 

Norma survived. Her mom did not. https://t.co/WE2AMEja1G

name: NPR
text:
Mark and Patricia McCloskey, the white St. Louis couple charged in July with waving firearms at Black Lives Matter protesters, have been indicted by a grand jury, the AP reports.
https://t.co/OFnNL7QY7l

name: NPR
text:
President Trump, who has continually dismissed the danger of the coronavirus, has received VIP treatment since he tested positive.

That includes an antibody cocktail from Regeneron — which fewer than 10 people have received outside of clinical trials.
https://t.co/qqWEpiM9a7

name: NPR
text:
Little Big Town, one of the biggest bands in country music, put on a Tiny Desk quarantine show. And they brought the hits.
https://t.co/WqlC6mghE6

name: NPR
text:
For many married women, one of South Korea's biggest holidays — Chuseok — traditionally involves visiting their in-laws and spending the time cooking and cleaning.

But because of the pandemic, many stayed home this year.
https://t.co/ToO5ifOyKd

name: NPR
text: Whale researchers normally work in teams, but that’s next to impossible these days. To keep tabs on the elusive and often endangered creatures, researchers have had to get creative. For some, it’s meant adding their spouses and even their pets to the team. https://t.co/IcYWBxj9C9

name: NPR
text:
There was an 81% increase in COVID-19 tests in D.C. Monday compared to a week ago.

"People work in the White House, and those people also shop at my grocery store and are out about town. It feels frankly really scary," said one resident.
https://t.co/oyy4UyszxB

name: NPR
text:
Most colleges holding in-person classes aren’t regularly testing students for the coronavirus, data obtained by NPR shows.

That could lead to even more cases later this fall, when the semester ends and students head home.
https://t.co/uyL39tKEBz

name: NPR
text:
For months, many experts who study the airborne transmission of viruses have been warning that the coronavirus can spread through the air.

Now, the CDC is acknowledging the same thing.
https://t.co/u6b8YyYjls

name: NPR
text:
These Republican senators are currently in quarantine:

• Ron Johnson*
• Ted Cruz
• James Lankford
• Mike Lee*
• Ben Sasse
• Thom Tillis*

*Tested positive for the coronavirus
https://t.co/hD9JwIXUOa

name: NPR
text:
The requirements for emergency authorization of a COVID-19 vaccine, laid out in new FDA guidance, underscore why it's unlikely a vaccine could clear the agency before Election Day.
https://t.co/yC660TyEo1

name: NPR
text:
Kamala Harris has called her time at Howard University "one of the most important aspects of my life."

Much of that time was spent studying economics — and becoming president of the Abram Harris Economics Society. (@planetmoney)
https://t.co/7csqIXxhw0

name: NPR
text:
Making a career switch can be daunting — but it *is* doable.

Don’t think of it as starting from square one. You have a wealth of transferable skills that you’ll bring with you.

More from @nprlifekit 👇
https://t.co/RfjXO7ncAD

name: NPR
text:
The Trump and Biden campaigns are both targeting Catholic voters in the swing state of Pennsylvania.

The GOP hopes opposition to abortion will fuel support for Trump. But Biden is a native of the state — and a lifelong Catholic who regularly attends mass.
https://t.co/3qZuEtUi3d

name: NPR
text:
The government scientist Rick Bright has resigned from the NIH, alleging top federal health officials blocked his efforts to roll out a plan aimed at better identifying and testing people with the coronavirus.
https://t.co/KUBEkp8ZxL

name: NPR
text: "The Rarities" is an indispensable addition to Mariah Carey's catalog as well as an illuminating, if incomplete, survey of pop and R&B as they've evolved over the past 30 years, Andrew Chan writes for @NPRMusic. https://t.co/SizlqNxoGD

name: NPR
text: Nine ZIP codes in New York City have seen persistently high rates of coronavirus infections. Mayor Bill de Blasio plans to close nonessential businesses and schools there Wednesday, pending state approval. https://t.co/SbmkavnaBq

name: NPR
text:
White House deputy press secretary Brian Morgenstern told NPR on Tuesday that masks are not currently mandated inside the White House.

And officials still won't say the total number of coronavirus cases among White House personnel.
https://t.co/d3qiAmTnUP

name: NPR
text:
The 2020 Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to two researchers who developed new techniques of genome editing — Emmanuelle Charpentier of France, and Jennifer Doudna of the U.S.
https://t.co/IaKpUwO2zm

name: NPR
text:
Once President Trump was diagnosed, public health guidelines dictated that he be isolated to help prevent the spread.

Instead, he took a joy ride between medical treatments at Walter Reed, exposing Secret Service agents to the coronavirus in the process.
https://t.co/XqNnv1HeKg

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden says “we shouldn’t have a debate” next week if President Trump is still infected with the coronavirus.

His comments came after Trump, who continues treatment for COVID-19, tweeted he was looking forward to next week's debate. https://t.co/b84MBDgtQ2

name: NPR
text:
Stocks opened higher, reversing yesterday's losses, amid word that Trump administration officials are considering stand-alone bills to aid airlines and small businesses.

Trump had called off negotiations on a stimulus bill in a tweet yesterday.
https://t.co/4DoFQJIMyd
